abstract: De mortuis nihil nisi bonum. Don't rip the dead. It seems to be the generous sentiment behind most of the coverage following the deaths of two Bay Area titans in the last week, Steve Jobs and Al Davis.
snippet: De mortuis nihil nisi bonum. Don't rip the dead. It seems to be the generous sentiment behind most of the coverage following the deaths of two Bay Area titans in the last week, Steve Jobs and Al Davis.
lead_paragraph: De mortuis nihil nisi bonum. Don't rip the dead. It seems to be the generous sentiment behind most of the coverage following the deaths of two Bay Area titans in the last week, Steve Jobs and Al Davis. And who can argue with that? Jobs was Apple; Davis was the Oakland Raiders; each transformed his industry. Who doesn't love an iPad (or appreciate Apple's market capitalization)? Who doesn't thrill to the high-arcing ''vertical'' bomb that results in a 60-yard touchdown?
